trans-unit.source: Supports the page parser in building a template and the child controls it contains.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceTemplateBuilder"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adds the specified literal content to a template.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The literal content to add to a template.
Adds builders to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceTemplateBuilder"></xref> object for any child controls that belong to the container control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceTemplateBuilder"></xref> for use after it is instantiated.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The template parser object that is responsible for parsing the control.
The control builder object that is responsible for building the parent control.
If the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> is not a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificControlBuilder"></xref> object, an exception is thrown.
The type that is assigned to the control that the builder will create.
The name of the tag to be built.
This enables the builder to support multiple tag types.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.ID*> attribute that is assigned to the control.
An object that holds the specified tag attributes.
